companies.name: TreeHouse Foods
brands: Produces store-brand: coffee, crackers, pickles, salad dressing, broth, pasta, snack bars, candy
Customers include Walmart, Kroger, Target, Aldi, Costco

companies.name: Pinnacle Foods (now part of Conagra)
companies.note: Acquired by Conagra in 2018. Brands now under Conagra.

companies.name: Bob Evans Farms (now Post Holdings)
brands: Bob Evans Grocery (refrigerated sides, sausage, mac & cheese)

companies.name: Dean Foods (defunct — 2019 bankruptcy)
companies.note: Filed bankruptcy 2019; assets sold to Dairy Farmers of America.

companies.name: Land O'Lakes
brands: Purina (animal feed — different from Nestlé Purina pet)

companies.name: Altria Group
brands: ZYN (10.2% stake in Swedish Match sold — now PMI)

companies.name: Kenvue
companies.note: Spun off from Johnson & Johnson in 2023. Many brands previously listed under J&J.

companies.name: Ferrero Group
companies.note: Acquired Nestlé US confectionery (Butterfinger, Crunch, Baby Ruth) in 2018 and Ferrara Candy.

companies.name: The Wonderful Company
companies.note: Owned by Stewart and Lynda Resnick.

companies.name: Constellation Brands
companies.note: Has perpetual US rights to Corona, Modelo, Pacifico beer brands.

companies.name: Del Monte Foods
companies.note: US Del Monte Foods is separate from Fresh Del Monte Produce.

companies.name: Smithfield Foods
companies.note: Owned by WH Group (China). Largest pork producer in the world.

companies.name: Lactalis
companies.note: World's largest dairy company. Private French company.

companies.name: Starbucks Corporation
companies.note: At-home coffee products are licensed to Nestlé under Global Coffee Alliance.

companies.name: The Scotts Miracle-Gro Company
brands: Roundup (consumer marketing, under license from Bayer)
